perturbation.original_text: Independent Contractor. Nothing contained herein or any document executed in connection herewith, shall be construed to create an employer-employee, partnership or joint venture relationship between VNUE and Promoter. Promoter is an independent contractor and not an officer, director, affiliate, insider, employee or agent of VNUE or any of its subsidiaries or affiliates. Promoter has no authority to, and will not, enter into contracts, make representations, warranties or commitments purporting to be binding on VNUE or otherwise act on VNUE's behalf and shall not take any action that might lead third parties to believe Promoter has the right to do so.
perturbation.changed_text: Independent Contractor. Nothing contained herein or any document executed in connection herewith, shall be construed to create an employer-employee, partnership or joint venture relationship between VNUE and Promoter. Promoter is an independent contractor, but may be considered an agent of VNUE for specific promotional activities. Promoter is not an officer, director, affiliate, insider, employee of VNUE or any of its subsidiaries or affiliates. Promoter has the limited authority to enter into contracts, make representations, warranties or commitments purporting to be binding on VNUE or otherwise act on VNUE's behalf and shall not take any action that might lead third parties to believe Promoter has the right to do so.
perturbation.explanation: By stating the Promoter 'may be considered an agent' and 'has the limited authority to enter into contracts,' the contract contradicts the initial statement that the Promoter is an 'independent contractor'. This creates ambiguity around the Promoter's legal status and liability, potentially violating Nevada agency law, which distinguishes between agents and independent contractors based on control and authority.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Nevada Agency Law, specifically regarding the definition and liabilities of agents vs. independent contractors.
perturbation.location: Preamble and Section regarding Independent Contractor

perturbation.original_text: Section 3. Expenses. VNUE shall reimburse Promoter for expenses incurred by Promoter while performing the duties herein. Promoter shall deliver to VNUE an itemized accounting of expenses incurred on a weekly basis, and VNUE shall reimburse Promoter within Thirty (30) Days of receipt of such accounting.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 3. Expenses. VNUE may, at its sole discretion, reimburse Promoter for expenses incurred by Promoter while performing the duties herein. Promoter shall deliver to VNUE an itemized accounting of expenses incurred. Reimbursement, if any, will be determined at the end of the contract.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that VNUE 'shall' reimburse expenses, creating an obligation. The modified text replaces 'shall' with 'may, at its sole discretion', removing the obligation to reimburse. This introduces a contradiction and uncertainty in the expense reimbursement, potentially conflicting with principles of contract law regarding consideration and good faith.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding consideration and good faith dealing.

perturbation.original_text: Section 2. Promoter's Fee. For providing services as set forth herein, VNUE will compensate Promoter i) Two Thousand Five Hundred Dollars ($2,500.00) for each One (1) Year contract Promoter secures per venue and Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000,00) for each Two (2) Year contract Promoter secures per venue, with payment due to Promoter within Thirty (30) Days from the date on which each such contract is countersigned; and ii) through the issuance of VNUE common stock as set forth below, and for the purposes of Rule 144 such shares of stock shall be deemed to have fully earned by Promoter upon the date of each issuance of such stock certificates by VStock Transfer: Three Million (3,000,000) shares of VNUE common stock shall be awarded to Promoter for performing Promotion Services as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: Section 2. Promoter's Fee. For providing services as set forth herein, VNUE will compensate Promoter i) A discretionary bonus of up to Two Thousand Five Hundred Dollars ($2,500.00) for each One (1) Year contract Promoter secures per venue and up to Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000,00) for each Two (2) Year contract Promoter secures per venue, with payment due to Promoter within a reasonable timeframe as determined by the VNUE accounting department; and ii) through the issuance of VNUE common stock as set forth below, and for the purposes of Rule 144 such shares of stock shall be deemed to have fully earned if the board of directors deems Promoter did not violate any of VNUE by laws: Three Million (3,000,000) shares of VNUE common stock may be awarded to Promoter for performing Promotion Services as follows:
perturbation.explanation: The original language specifies a clear and definite fee schedule and award of shares for each contract secured. The modified language changes this to a 'discretionary bonus' and 'may be awarded' depending on performance, introducing ambiguity and potentially contradicting the original intent of a fixed fee for services. This may run afoul of contract law principles that require clarity and certainty in the terms of compensation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding clarity and certainty in compensation terms.
